info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 9:53AM EDT until April 7 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Stoner Creek at Paris affecting Bourbon County.
.Heavy rain from the past few days will cause the river to remain in flood for the next day or so.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Stoner Creek at Paris.
* WHEN...Until this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water floods a few low roads on right bank of creek. At 20.0 feet, Water enters yards of homes downstream of water plant. Parts of the Garrard Park flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Monday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM EDT Monday was 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 11.5 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 02/13/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by this evening at 600 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING
